pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors
Class BinaryVector

java.lang.Object
  pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.Vector
      pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.BinaryVector

public class BinaryVector
extends Vector

Binary implementation of Vector. Uses an "elemental" representation which is a single bit string (Lucene OpenBitSet). Superposes on this a "semantic" representation which contains the weights with which different vectors have been added (superposed) onto this one. Calling superpose(pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.Vector, double, int[]) causes the voting record to be updated, but for performance the votes are not tallied back into the elemental bit set representation until normalize() or one of the writing functions is called.

Author:
cohen

generateRandomVector

public BinaryVector generateRandomVector(int dimension,
                                         int numEntries,
                                         java.util.Random random)
Description copied from class: Vector
Creates a sparse vector with appropriate entries from the random seed. Ideally this would be a static method of the implementing class, but it's not easy to express this with either an abstract class or an interface. Client implementations should use the VectorFactory class, hence the protected status.

Specified by:
generateRandomVector in class Vector
Parameters:
dimension - number of dimension of vector returned
numEntries - number of non-zero entries, usually a combination of +/-1 entries as determined by implementation
random - random seed for generation

superpose

public void superpose(Vector other,
                      double weight,
                      int[] permutation)
Description copied from class: Vector
Superposes other vector onto this one with given weight, usually by vector addition. Coordinates of other vector may be permuted and reweighted in the process. Permuted coordinates supports encoding of order information, as begun by Sahlgren, Holst and Kanerva 2008.

Specified by:
superpose in class Vector
Parameters:
other - vector to be added
weight - multiple of other vector added (TODO widdows support complex weights)
permutation - represents the permutation to be applied while adding, so that the ith coordinate of other is added to the coordinate given by the ith entry in this list. Can be NULL in which case no permutation is applied.

superposeBitSet

protected void superposeBitSet(org.apache.lucene.util.OpenBitSet incomingBitSet,
                               double weight)
This method is the first of two required to facilitate superposition. The underlying representation (i.e. the voting record) is an ArrayList of OpenBitSet, each with dimension "dimension", which can be thought of as an expanding 2D array of bits. Each column keeps count (in binary) for the respective dimension, and columns are incremented in parallel by sweeping a bitset across the rows. In any dimension in which the BitSet to be added contains a "1", the effect will be that 1's are changed to 0's until a new 1 is added (e.g. the column '110' would become '001' and so forth). The first method deals with floating point issues, and accelerates superposition by decomposing the task into segments.

Parameters:
incomingBitSet -
weight -

superposeBitSetFromRowFloor

protected void superposeBitSetFromRowFloor(org.apache.lucene.util.OpenBitSet incomingBitSet,
                                           int rowfloor)
Performs superposition from a particular row by sweeping a bitset across the voting record such that for any column in which the incoming bitset contains a '1', 1's are changed to 0's until a new 1 can be added, facilitating incrementation of the binary number represented in this column.

Parameters:
incomingBitSet - the bitset to be added
rowfloor - the index of the place in the voting record to start the sweep at

reverse

public static java.lang.String reverse(java.lang.String str)
Reverses a string - simplifies the decoding of the binary vector for the 'exact' method although it wouldn't be difficult to reverse the counter instead

concludeVote

protected org.apache.lucene.util.OpenBitSet concludeVote()
This method is used determine which dimension will receive 1 and which 0 when the voting process is concluded. It produces an OpenBitSet in which "1" is assigned to all dimension with a count > 50% of the total number of votes (i.e. more 1's than 0's added) "0" is assigned to all dimension with a count < 50% of the total number of votes (i.e. more 0's than 1's added) "0" or "1" are assigned to all dimension with a count = 50% of the total number of votes (i.e. equal 1's and 0's added)

Returns:
an OpenBitSet representing the superposition of all vectors added up to this point

decrement

public void decrement()
Decrement every dimension. Assumes at least one count in each dimension i.e: no underflow check currently - will wreak havoc with zero counts

decrement

public void decrement(int weight)
Decrement every dimension by the number passed as a parameter. Again at least one count in each dimension i.e: no underflow check currently - will wreak havoc with zero counts

normalize

public void normalize()
Description copied from class: Vector
Transforms vector to a normalized representation. A normalized representation should satisfy the property that measureOverlap with itself is equal to 1.0, to within precision tolerances.

Specified by:
